alert.note: Alert for Eastern Pima-Southeastern Pinal-Santa Cruz-Western Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 30 at 2:13PM MST until October 01 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR STRONG GUSTY SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND HIGH TO VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 151... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 6 PM MST SUNDAY FOR STRONG GUSTY SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND HIGH TO VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 151... The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 10 AM to 6 PM MST Sunday. Red Flag Warning remains in effect through 7 PM MST this evening. * TIMING...Through 7 PM MST this evening and from 10 AM to 6 PM MST Sunday. * WINDS...South to southwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent today and 13 to 18 percent Sunday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop or are ongoing will have the potential to spread rapidly. * FOR A DETAILED VIEW OF THE HAZARD AREA...Visit weather.gov/Tucson and click on the Detailed Hazards Icon.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or are expected to develop. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and dry vegetation will create the potential for rapid and erratic fire growth. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of the Red Flag Warning for portions of Southeast Arizona.
